Html:
I can't seem to find Management Studio Express for SQL Server Express 2008.  The tutorial from MS certainly implies (strongly) that it exists.  Nevertheless, I can only find Management Studio Express for SQL Server Express 2005.  I won't work with my 2008 download.

I must prep for a class.  Can anyone point me to a link for Management Studio Express for SQL Server Express 2008?  If not, can anyone say definitively that I should give up hope and uninstall 2008/install 2005?

Howdy, dragginfly. The SQL Server 2008 Express with Tools just went live on Friday along with Express with Advanced Services.

SQL Server 2008 Express with Advanced Services (ENU): http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=B5D1B8C3-FDA5-4508-B0D0-1311D670E336&displaylang=en

SQL Server 2008 Express with Tools (ENU): http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=7522A683-4CB2-454E-B908-E805E9BD4E28&displaylang=en

You should be able to use the Enterprise evaluation, too, if you'd rather have the full experience instead of using Express.

Does that help?

Thanks for the informative reply.  My issue may be similar.  Attempting to install SQL Server 2008 Express with Advanced Services to Vista SP1.  Passes all tests and installs engine but fails to install SSMS (mgmt studio) or BIDS (BI studio).  After install, unable to connect to engine locally even though it is running.

Below is from the SSMS log file, BIDS error is similar.  Any thoughts greatly appreciated.  Also, please feel free to instruct as to protocol if I should have created a new discussion.

MSI (s) (2C:88) [11:32:13:809]: Executing op: SetTargetFolder(Folder=C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\VSShell\Common7\Tools\VDT\1033\)

MSI (s) (2C:88) [11:32:13:817]: File: C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\VSShell\Common7\Tools\VDT\1033\vdt80ui.dll; To be installed; Won't patch; No existing file

Howdy, MacroChaotic. The setup problem will probably be more quickly answered in one of the TechNet forums:

SQL Server Katmai Express
http://forums.microsoft.com/TechNet/ShowForum.aspx?ForumID=1621&SiteID=17

SQL Server Katmai Setup and Upgrade
http://forums.microsoft.com/TechNet/ShowForum.aspx?ForumID=1627&SiteID=17

The log reads as if part of the package is missing. You might uninstall everything and try again from zero, but perhaps someone on the forums have a better answer.
Thanks kindly.  Will do.  Appreciate your help.
